You have a Fabric workspace named Workspace1 that has the cache for shortcuts enabled. Workspace1 contains a lakehouse named Lakehouse1. Lakehouse1 has the shortcuts shown in the following table.

You need to read data from all the shortcuts.
Which shortcuts will retrieve data from the cache?
discussion:
Shortcut caching can be used to reduce egress costs associated with cross-cloud data access. As files are read through an external shortcut, the files are stored in a cache for the Fabric workspace. Subsequent read requests are served from cache rather than the remote storage provider. Cached files have a retention period of 24 hours.

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/fabric/onelake/onelake-shortcuts#caching

Fabric only supports shortcut caching when Fabric can convert the source into Delta.

Answer: C — Stores and Products only

Why: With Cache for shortcuts enabled, Fabric serves data from cache only if the shortcut was accessed within the last 24 hours.

Products → last accessed 12 hours ago → cached

Stores → last accessed 4 hours ago → cached

Trips → last accessed 48 hours ago → cache expired → reads from source, not cache

Therefore, only Stores and Products will be retrieved from the cache.

The retention period for cached files can be set from 1-28 days.
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/fabric/onelake/onelake-shortcuts

As nothing has been explicitly stated regarding cache retention period, one can assume it is still the default value of 1 day. 
Hence, cache retention of 24 hours has been expired for Trips and it will be read from source again.

From doc page: 
Shortcut caching can reduce egress costs associated with cross-cloud data access. As files are read through an external shortcut, the files are stored in a cache for the Fabric workspace. Subsequent read requests are served from cache rather than the remote storage provider. The retention period for cached files can be set from 1-28 days. Each time the file is accessed, the retention period is reset. If the file in remote storage provider is more recent than the file in the cache, the request is served from remote storage provider and the updated file will then be stored in cache. If a file hasn’t been accessed for more than the selected retention period, it's purged from the cache. Individual files greater than 1 GB in size aren't cached.
